intro: Paepalanthus niger, commonly known as the black puya, is a striking plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its tall, spiky inflorescence that can reach up to two meters in height. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically dark red or black, which give it its common name. Paepalanthus niger thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
